content: sizes s m l measurements approx 9 cm x 10 cm 13 cm x 15 cm 18 cm x 21 cm yarn fingering + lace held together i have not taken approximate yarn measurements but it takes very very little for the smallest size thus why it has been dubbed the scrap bag the larger sizes will require more yardage the gray bag is knitted in a size small with isager silk mohair in the color 3s and isager alpaca 2 in the color e2s the two yarns are held together throughout the entire project including the drawstrings the beige bag is a size s worked with drops brushed alpaca silk and baby merino both in light beige held together the drawstring is a ribbon blue version by @snug_barcelona gauge 25 sts x 35 row = 10 cm x 10 cm 4 in x 4 in in stockinette stitch needles 3 0 mm us 2 5 // 80 cm or 100 cm needles 32 inches or 40 inches to use the magic loop method construction the scrap bag is worked seamlessly from the bottom-up in the round until the body of the bag is completed the stitches are then divided evenly into two sections and a folded hem is worked on both sides of the bag finally simple crochet drawstrings are created and inserted through the folded hems to create a closure you may also choose to knit i-cord drawstrings for the larger bags ribbon or any other drawstring alternative may be used as well for drawstrings this bag is highly customizable you can cast on as few or many stitches as you like you can knit the bag as large or small as you like so long as the drawstring mechanism is still functional super special thank you to my proof-readers @fall_knits @cottonknotatelier @katknits2902 @whoknitwhat @maypuff knits
